page.title: 11Church and Chapel - update
page.content: WITCHAMPTON CHURCH: in 1984 in Witchampton Church a small crypt was discovered under the South Transept. This was opened up and a staircase was built from the crypt to the vestry. The church has a Parish Communion service at 10am every Sunday except for the 1st Sunday of the month when there is a Family Service. WITCHAMPTON METHODIST CHURCH: the chapel was built in 1890 on the site of a 19th century chapel. The chapel has its own burial ground, it is said that the Romans used the terraced ground on the western side of the church towards the chapel as vineyards. The chapel has its own hall used for a variety of local activities including the Brownie Pack meetings. The chapel has no resident Minister but is served from Wimborne, having services each Sunday at 10.45am.
